blocks.latex: b = x \text{ mean value of } b.
blocks.description: This equation expresses the mean value of the variable $b$.

blocks.text: If $B$, $P$ and $Q$ are taken to be close to one another, the mean of average slopes become the actual slopes and the relationship is $dK = MP' + NQ$.
Example 18—If Kinetic Energy $K$ = $\frac{1}{2}mv^{2}$, find the change in the energy as $m$ changes from $150$ to $159$.
From the above rule, the change in $K = 8K$

blocks.description: This equation calculates the change in kinetic energy using the difference of squares.

blocks.latex: dK = \frac{\partial K}{\partial t} \times \Delta v + \frac{\partial K}{\partial m} \times \Delta m = 8K \xrightarrow{=}(49 \times -10) + (\Delta m)(1) = -\left(\frac{5}{8}\right) \times 159 \times 49 \times 10
blocks.description: This equation represents the total differential of kinetic energy with respect to mass and velocity.

blocks.text: Example 19—A quantity of water $V$ is measured by $Q = D \cdot V$.
If $I$, the probable error of $D$, a diametric $I$, = the probable error of $R$, and $R$ = the probable error of $L$.

blocks.description: This equation expresses the relationship involving errors in diametric measures.
